comment.body: "Mastodon": from the Greek for "nipple tooth". Although no word on whether it's a "female-presenting nipple" and if that contravenes content guidelines ;)

@Kaffie: Via the comparison I posted about [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Ctjcvfovq6d1JWEGvM1JovCym4H6Es33L/?Post:6:Big+comparison+of+secure+/+anonymous+/+decentralized+/+private+communication+systems), GNU Project's Secushare team really [criticize the whole idea of federation as deeply flawed](https://secushare.org/federation) and as a slippery slope to [centralization](https://secushare.org/centralization).
42/201 for me
"Heinz's Pieses"?

I thought it was because the Trip Advisor reviews are terrible.
+ "Slow rude service, unhygienic."
+ "McDonald's everywhere."
+ "Totally played out. Alpha Centauri is where it's at these days."

Damn, I forgot the review from [the ***real*** resource used by interplanetary travellers](https://hitchhikers.fandom.com/wiki/Earth):
> Earth, also known as Sol III, was a giant supercomputer designed to find the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe and Everything. [...] it was commonly mistaken for a planet, especially by the ape descendants who lived on it. It was situated far out in the uncharted backwaters of the unfashionable end of the Western Spiral Arm of the Galaxy.
I used to play this on the Atari Jaguar. If only I'd known there were much cheaper options...

On a serious note, it would be cool if a ZeroMe meme (ZeroMeMeme?) generator just produced each image once (Sean Bean, business cat) and then overlaid the unique text each person writes on top.

That way we only need to download and store one copy of the image, no matter how many times the meme gets used.

[Linux gaming is on a life-support system called Steam](https://www.osnews.com/story/129439/linux-gaming-is-on-a-life-support-system-called-steam/)

IIRC some studies have shown that 'neuter and release' works better than destruction at reducing feral cat & dog populations.
.
Killing the ones you catch leaves more food for the slippery ones you *didn't* catch, who produce much more young as a result. (Young who, by the way, will likely inherit their parents' "hard-to-catchiness".)
.
Whereas neutered animals returned to "the wild"
+ don't make any more little animals
+ consume much of the available food supply, causing even reproductive animals to reproduce less

.
thus leading to a reduction in the feral population overall.
@Styromaniac: If there's a truly wild competitor in the mix, that presumably does change the picture for 'neuter and release' of ferals. Especially if the species are close enough to interbreed.

I'm not sure if I understand exactly what you mean , but if you find solutions / have ideas to automatically getting clearnet articles via 0net, I'd be interested.
.
What I'm doing for now with [a clearnet news blog on my 0net blog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NEuAUKgUoY6fnXeXBaonjrDfNbfpQpdMp/?Post:4:UK+Newspapers+Front+Pages+-+Sunday+24th+March+2019):
1. I visit the clearnet blog, adjusting browser width and scrolling through the whole page (in order to load maximum resolution images, as it's a "responsive design" page).
2. I save the page (at first using my browser's "save as .mhtml", now using [SingleFile](https://github.com/gildas-lormeau/SingleFile) browser extension)
3. I upload the resulting file to ZeroUpUnlimited.
4. I make a post about it on my blog, with a link to the file on ZeroUp Unlimited.

.
It's all very manual and dependent on my bothering to do it. I also [wondered about an archive-type site](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1553707562_131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/What+do+you+think+about+having+a+ZeroArchive+to+save+websites) on 0net, which is probably far too ambitious.
.
But if I understand you right, do you mean the inverse of a 0net proxy? A 0net zite that acts as a sort of intermediary which fetches and displays the clearnet articles you want but without you visiting them directly, with you staying within ZeroNet? Cause that sounds very interesting.
@Krixano: Sounds cool!

re webm, remember that [they can't be embedded in ZeroBlog posts](http://127.0.0.1:43110/15mQd6kBRzriaVEjdELujex2YKFfWaA8JQ/?Post:7:Inserting+a+WebM+into+a+ZeroBlog+post). Not sure about other kinds of 0net pages. Whereas MP4 embeds just fine.

With some, there's simply no point engaging; their reactions won't make sense because they aren't really about the issues being discussed but actually about their own issues in life. And if they want drama in life, then drama is what any discussion with them will become.
.
Just disengage and, like any other damage on the internet, route around them.
.
Or, if contact is unavoidable, practise something like [medium chill](https://outofthefog.website/what-to-do-2/2015/12/3/medium-chill).
.
Well, that's my 2 cents any ways.

Maybe get some practice by volunteering to read a few short stories or poems at public domain audiobook site Librivox (which provides some help, tips etc)
+ https://librivox.org/pages/volunteer-for-librivox/
+ https://wiki.librivox.org/index.php/Main_Page#Volunteering
+ https://forum.librivox.org/viewtopic.php?f=18&t=877

I ilke the concept, but there are some issues with What3Words: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/What3words

Unfortunately the open source alternatives (like Google's [Plus Codes](https://plus.codes/) ) seem to all be harder-to-handle random strings of letters & numbers.
Have you tried it yet?
@FraYoshi: I like the way [ZeroSites](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Sites.ZeroNetwork.bit/) does it, as you can even select more than one language at a time (useful for multilingual people).
PS Although ZeroSites does only offer an extremely short list of languages; ideally you should be able to choose any language you want, for tagging and for filtering.
